newsitem.title: PANAMA: Mexico's ICA to begin Panama highway.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's ICA to begin Panama highway.

text.p: Mexican company Ingenieros Civiles Asociados S.A. will begin construction on a $222.3 million highway in Panama on Thursday, a company representative told local television stations late Wednesday.
ICA will build a four-lane, 20-km highway linking Panama City to the Pan American Highway over two years, ICA representative Nicolas Trejo said.

The highway will begin at Balboa Avenue which hugs the Bay of Panama, continue over a portion of the water, return to land near the Tocumen international airport then connect with the Pan American Highway, he said.
The company will charge a one-way toll of $1.80. Trejo did not say how long the concession would last.
